Author: yagibear
Title: The Economic Naturalist
Content: I recommend Robert H. Frank's book "The Economic Naturalist" for insight into everyday economics (extracts at http://freakonomics.blogs.nytimes.com/2007/06/22/why-do-reti... and http://freakonomics.blogs.nytimes.com/2007/07/13/more-from-t...). As those URLs suggest, it is of the Freakonomics genre, though IMHO better than the original Freaknomics by being broader and more fundamental. Ch 3 ("Why equally talented workers often earn different salaries...") resonates with PG's articles about inequality/productivity, though unfortunately I can't find extracts from that chapter online.

Author: staunch
Content:
I was just in Palo Alto for a couple days. I stayed in Dinah's Garden Hotel in a "Deluxe" room with patio facing a pond. (El Camino Real). Quite nice for the price I paid.

Ate some breakfasts at Peninsula Fountain & Grill (Emerson/Hamilton). Classic American diner.

Drinking at "Old Pro" (great mini burgers) and other bars in the area which are more difficult to remember. (University/Ramona). Pretty good.

Author: breily
Content: It seems to me that the 'emerging monopolies' wouldn't kill your startup, but be a good thing, as getting bought seems to be a worthwhile goal.
